oai_dc:dc.dc:title: King Chapel at Union Ridge COGIC: church marquee sign
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: King Chapel at Union Ridge Church of God in Christ
Color photograph of church marquee sign surrounded by brickwork. Sign reads "King Chapel Church at Union Ridge, Church of God in Christ, W. L...Pastor." Brick building is visible in the background.

The current King Chapel Church building dates from the 1960s. Vinyl siding was added to the frame and additional work was completed in the 1980s. At the time of fieldwork (July 23, 1998), W. L. Rippy served as pastor and the church was thought to have once been the largest in the village.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee;
marquees; brickwork;
